attributes.action: Levy an excise duty on chocolate production in order to reduce consumption in light of the Government Chief Scientific Advisors' warnings on obesity.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Chocolate is addictive, highly calorifically dense and so cheap that in UK supermarkets you can buy a entire days worth of calories as chocolate for a single pound. 

Chocolate is inexpensive and the British public is gorging itself on it. We consume over 600,000 tonnes per year - four times more that the Italians.

Current UK scientific consensus is that by 2050, 55% of the nation will be obese with the cost to the Health Service being 6.5Billion pounds a year where currently it is 1Billion pounds pa. A tax levy on chocolate which is a major contributor to the nations obesity would be a workable and effective way to reduce current over-consumption.

as a footnote:
We consume around 60,000 calories of chocolate per head, per year. That equates to  around 30 days worth of calories from chocolate alone - before crisps, biscuits and fizzy drinks etc.
